sentences.en: A pheasant is a delicacy we seldom can enjoy.
sentences.cn: 野鸡是我们很少能品尝到的美味.

sentences.en: He sensed the delicacy of the situation.
sentences.cn: 他感觉到了形势的微妙。

sentences.en: He's shown considerable delicacy and tact in feeling the public mood.
sentences.cn: 他在体察民情方面表现得相当周到和练达。

sentences.en: I need to talk to you about a matter of some delicacy.
sentences.cn: 我需要和你谈个有点棘手的问题.

sentences.en: It's a situation that calls for a blend of delicacy and force.
sentences.cn: 应付这种局面需要刚柔并济。

sentences.en: Miss Costigan was a paragon of virtue and delicacy!
sentences.cn: 科斯蒂根小姐是一位高尚完美的天生尤物!

sentences.en: She has full of feminine delicacy.
Smoked herring is a local delicacy.
sentences.cn: 烟熏鲱鱼是当地一种美味食品.

sentences.en: Smoked salmon was considered an expensive delicacy.
sentences.cn: 熏鲑鱼被认为是一道昂贵的珍馐。

sentences.en: Snails are considered a delicacy in France.
sentences.cn: 在法国，蜗牛被认为是一种珍贵的美食。

sentences.en: The delicacy of roses makes them unfit for an extreme climate.
sentences.cn: 玫瑰因其娇贵纤弱而不能适应极冷或极热的气候.

sentences.en: The flesh of this kind of fish has exceptional delicacy.
The girl's delicacy [ delicate health ] has always worried her parents.
sentences.cn: 这女孩 纤弱 的体质一直使她的父母感到忧虑.

sentences.en: There is a matter of some delicacy which I would like to discuss.
sentences.cn: 有件有点儿棘手的事我想要商量一下。

sentences.en: We admired the delicacy of the craftsmanship.
sentences.cn: 我们佩服工艺师精巧的手艺.

words.tran_cn: 微妙的；精美的，雅致的；柔和的；易碎的；纤弱的；清淡可口的

trans.tran_cn: 精美，娇嫩，雅致，微妙，棘手，周到，佳肴
trans.tran_en: something good to eat that is expensive or rare
